column1: Symptoms of a foot sprain include: - Pain and tenderness near the arch of the foot.
- Bruising and swelling of the foot - Pain when walking or during activity - Not being able to put weight on your foot.
If it is painful to put weight on your foot, your provider may give you a splint or crutches to use while your foot heals.
For pain, you can use ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin), naproxen (Aleve, Naprosyn), or acetaminophen (Tylenol).
- Talk with your provider before using these medicines if you have heart disease, high blood pressure, kidney disease, or have had stomach ulcers or internal bleeding in the past.
Call the health care provider if: - You have sudden numbness or tingling.
